tables.name: person
tables.description: Central identity management for all Persons in the database containing records that uniquely identify each person or patient and some demographic information

features.description: Concept ID representing the biological sex at birth
Concept ID representing race or ethnic background
Reference to the last known location
Reference to the last known primary care provider
Reference to the care site where provider provides primary care

features.description: Unique identifier for each observation period
Concept ID representing the provenance of the observation period

tables.description: Events where persons engage with the healthcare system for a duration of time

features.description: Concept ID representing the kind of visit
Concept ID representing the provenance of the visit record
Concept ID for where patient was admitted from
Concept ID for where patient was discharged to

tables.description: Details of each record in the parent visit_occurrence table such as movement between units

features.description: Unique identifier for each visit detail
Concept ID representing the kind of visit detail
Concept ID representing the provenance of the visit detail record
Visit detail type from source data
Source concept ID for visit detail
Concept ID for where patient was admitted from
Concept ID for where patient was discharged to
Reference to immediately preceding visit detail

tables.description: Encoded information that is extracted from unstructured note text

Character offset of snippet in note

Concept ID representing the provenance of the specimen record

features.description: Unique identifier for each cost record

Number of drug exposures in era

features.description: Unique identifier for each dose era
Standard concept ID for the drug

tables.name: metadata

tables.description: Information about the source data used to create the CDM instance

features.description: Name of organization responsible for development of CDM instance
URL or reference to ETL documentation
Date when source data was released

tables.name: concept
tables.description: Standardized vocabularies to represent clinical concepts

features.description: Code of concept in source vocabulary

tables.name: vocabulary
tables.description: List of vocabularies collected from various sources

tables.name: domain
tables.description: List of domains that classify concepts

tables.name: concept_class
tables.description: List of concept classes that classify concepts within vocabularies

features.description: Unique identifier for each concept class
Concept ID for the concept class

tables.description: Relationships between concepts

tables.name: relationship
tables.description: List of relationship types used in concept relationships

features.description: Unique identifier for each relationship type

tables.name: concept_synonym
tables.description: Alternative names and descriptions for concepts

tables.name: concept_ancestor
tables.description: Hierarchical relationships between concepts

features.description: Standard concept ID being mapped to

tables.name: drug_strength
tables.description: Strength information for drug concepts

features.description: Number of units in a box
Date when drug strength became valid
Date when drug strength became invalid
Reason why drug strength is invalid

tables.name: cohort_definition
tables.description: The COHORT_DEFINITION table contains records defining a Cohort derived from the data through the associated description and syntax and upon instantiation (execution of the algorithm) placed into the COHORT table. Cohorts are a set of subjects that satisfy a given combination of inclusion criteria for a duration of time.

features.description: A unique identifier for each Cohort Definition
A short description of the Cohort Definition
A complete description of the Cohort Definition
A foreign key to the Concept representing the definition type (e.g. cohort definition language, phenotype algorithm)
Syntax or code to operationalize the Cohort Definition
A foreign key to the Concept representing the domain of subjects that are members of the cohort (e.g., Person, Provider, Visit)
A date to indicate when the Cohort Definition was initiated

tables.name: attribute_definition
tables.description: The ATTRIBUTE_DEFINITION table contains records to define each attribute through an associated description and syntax. Attributes are derived elements that can be selected or calculated for a subject within a cohort. The ATTRIBUTE_DEFINITION table provides a standardized structure for maintaining the rules governing the calculation of covariates for a subject in a cohort, and can store operational programming code to instantiate the attributes for a given cohort within the OMOP Common Data Model.

features.description: A unique identifier for each Attribute Definition
A short description of the Attribute
A complete description of the Attribute Definition
Type defining what kind of Attribute Definition the record represents and how the syntax may be executed
Syntax or code to operationalize the Attribute Definition
